IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE-V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES), THIRUVANANTHAPURAM.
Present:- Smt. Aswathy.S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Tuesday the 21 day of January, 2025./ 1* Makha, 1946.
CCG. 547/2017
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Thumba Police
Station in Crime No. 998/2012.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused : 1. Binoy P Thomas, S/o. Thomas, aged 48 years, S/o.
Thomas, Vijaya Nivas (MRA/B/52), Near Thekkekunnu
Junction, Kulathoor Ward, Attipra Village.
2. Usha, aged 47 years, D/o. Vijyamma, Vijaya Nivas
(MRA/B/52), Near Thekkekunnu Junction, Kulathoor
Ward, Attipra Village.
(By Advocate Sri. Sreekanth.S.G)
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 341, 323 and 324 read with
section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence : Accused numbers 1 and 2 are found not guilty of offences
punishable under sections 341, 323 and 324 read with section 34
of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are acquitted of the said
offences under section 248(1) Code of Criminal Procedure,
1973. Their bail bonds stand cancelled and they are set at liberty.

This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 341, 323 and 324
read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. The prosecution case in brief _is as follows :- On 21.11.2012, at 9.00
house,Nirmalalayam Convent Thekkekunnu road Manvila, Kulathoor Ward,
Attipra Village, accused No.1 wrongfully restrained and hit on his chest and
shoulder and he again beat on his chest and kicked on his abdomen. Further
accused No.1 beat CW2 on his shoulder with a chair. Accused No.1 beaten
CW1 on his with a wooden piece when he evaded the same with his left hand
thereby caused caused injury and caused dislocation of his hand. Further
accused uttered obscene words and threatened to kill him. Thus accused Nos. 1
and 2 thereby committed offenses u/s. 341, 323 and 324 read with section 34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3 of 6

3. Final report was filed by the Sub Inspector of police, Thumba_ police station
before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II, Thiruvananthapuram and
the case was taken on file as C.C. 488/2013. Cognizance was taken for the
offences punishable u/ss. 294(b), 323, 324 and 506(ii) read with 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 against the accused persons. Thereafter, it was transferred to
this court, in pursuance of the order of the Hon'ble Chief Judicial Magistrate,
Thiruvananthapuram, the case was refiled as CC. 547/2017.

4. On appearance of the accused Nos. 1 and 2 they were enlarged on bail on
29.05.2013. Copies of all relevant prosecution records were furnished to them
under section 207 Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. Since ingredients of
offence u/ss.294(b) and 506(ii) were not attracted after hearing prosecution and
counsel for accused Nos. 1 and 2 offence u/ss. 294(b) and 506(ii) were deleted
and charge framed for offences u/ss. 341, 323 and 324 read with section 34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860, read over and explained to the accused Nos. 1 and 2
to which they pleaded not guilty and claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 to PW3 were examined and Exhibit P1 was
marked. As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the
learned Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW2 to CW11. In the absence
of any incriminating circumstances against the accused Nos. 1 and 2,
questioning of the accused Nos. 1 and 2. Procedure, 1973 was dispensed with.

4 of 6

Accused Nos 1 and 2 were called upon to adduce evidence but no defence

evidence was adduced from the side of the accused Nos 1 and 2.

6. Heard both sides and perued records.

7. The following points have arisen for determination:

(1) Whether on 21.11.2012, at 9.00 house,Nirmalalayam Convent Thekkekunnu
road Manvila, Kulathoor Ward, Attipra Village, infurtherance of their
common intention of accused Nos. 1 and 2, accused No.1 wrongfully
restrained PW2 and thereby committed offence punishable under section
341 r/w. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(2) Whether on the same time and place accused Nos. 1 and 2 infurtherance of
their common intention, the accused persons voluntarily caused hurt to
PW1 and have thereby committed offence punishable under section 323
read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

(3) Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 and 2 in
furtherance of their common intention assaulted with a dangerous wooden
piece resulting in injury and thereby accused Nos. 1 and 2 committed an
offence punishable w/s. 324 read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code,
1860 ?

(4) If the accused Nos. 1 and 2 are found guilty? What is the order as to
sentence?

8. Point Nos.1 to 3 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point nos.1 to 3 are
considered together. Prosecution case is that accused have committed offences
punishable under sections 341, 323 and 324 read with section 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 .

5 of 6

9. PW1, Ramachandran Nair admitted his statement before the police regarding
the alleged incident of this case and he identified his signature in the first
information statement which is marked as Ext. P1. According to him the
accused persons were not assaulted him and he has no grievance against the
accused persons.

10. PW2, Sreekuttan deposed that he has not sustained any injury in the alleged
incident of this case and he denied the statement before the police .

11.PW3, Rajesh Kumar deposed that he has not sustained any injury in the
alleged incident of this case and he denied the statement before the police .

12. The learned Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up other witnesses and he is
justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused Nos. 1 and 2. and for
the said reason these points are found against the prosecution. CC. 353/2018
is the counter case of the above case and both cases were considered together.

13. Point No. 4 :- Upon the finding in point Nos. 1 to 3, the accused Nos. 1 and 2
are found not guilty of offences punishable under sections 341, 323 and 324
read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are acquitted for the

6 of 6
said offences under section 248(1) of Criminal Procedure Code 1973. Their
bail bonds stand cancelled and they are set at liberty.
No material objects are produced in this case.
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 21* day of January, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
